metadata.synopsis: Dalyria and Petras at the flophouse.They are looking for Astarion at the place where they used to "hunt".This is a dialog for when they meet Astarion-companion with player-Avatar.They will tell Astarion they must inform Cazador that Astarion is back in the city. They will also reveal that Cazador is planning a ritual that requires all the spawn and that will grant them new powers.If the player & Astarion know that Cazador is actually planning to sacrifice all the spawn, he might be able to convince the spawn about this sacrifice. In exchange, they will reveal a bit of information about Cazador's Palace.After the dialog they disappear as clouds of mist.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Origin Debug Book (Ctrl+Shift+7)Astarion - Recruit - As CompanionAstarion - Act 3 Origin Moments - Vampire Spawns Duo at FlophouseWalk in the direction the player character is facing.Click on Petra or Dalyria.

69.speaker: Dalyria
69.text: We should go. I do not want to face the master if we're late for his Black Mass.
69.context: NodeContext: Incredulous that they believed Cazador

95.speaker: Pale Petras
95.text: Soon, sister. I only need one more mark.
95.context: NodeContext: Incredulous that they believed Cazador

148.speaker: Dalyria
148.text: We have enough for the master - no more are needed.
148.context: NodeContext: Incredulous that they believed Cazador

96.speaker: Pale Petras
96.text: It's not for the master, it's for me. I spent one hundred years eating rats and dogs, but soon I'll be able to feast.
96.context: NodeContext: Incredulous that they believed Cazador

43.speaker: Pale Petras
43.text: I want someone there, ready for me. And once the Mass is done and our lord grants us our freedom, I can celebrate by drinking them dry.
43.context: NodeContext: Incredulous that they believed Cazador

109.speaker: Astarion
109.text: Cazador promised you your freedom? And you believed him?
109.context: NodeContext: Incredulous that they believed Cazador

111.speaker: Astarion
111.text: You were never burdened with intelligence, Petras, but your load seems especially light these days.
111.context: NodeContext: startled, drops her voice to almost a whisper for "Kill the master", as if she's afraid her master will hear

112.speaker: Dalyria
112.context: NodeContext: startled, drops her voice to almost a whisper for "Kill the master", as if she's afraid her master will hear

28.speaker: Astarion
28.text: That's no way to welcome back a brother, Dal. Didn't you miss me?
28.context: NodeContext: startled, drops her voice to almost a whisper for "Kill the master", as if she's afraid her master will hear

138.speaker: Dalyria
138.text: Why would you come back? You got out - you were free.
138.context: NodeContext: startled, drops her voice to almost a whisper for "Kill the master", as if she's afraid her master will hear

48.speaker: Player
48.text: We're here to kill Cazador. That's the only way you'll be free.
48.context: NodeContext: startled, drops her voice to almost a whisper for "Kill the master", as if she's afraid her master will hear

106.speaker: Dalyria
106.context: NodeContext: startled, drops her voice to almost a whisper for "Kill the master", as if she's afraid her master will hear

94.speaker: Pale Petras
94.text: He's playing mind games. He can't raise a hand to the master, let alone kill him.

141.speaker: Astarion
141.text: You have no idea what I can do.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: What is Cazador planning? What do you know?
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion grabs Petra by the throat and drags him over towards the window. Standing full in the daylight, Astarion slowly pulls Petra closer and closer to the sunbeam.

97.speaker: Pale Petras
97.text: Of course that's why he came crawling back. He wants to ascend with the rest of us.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: Just tell us about the ritual. What do you know?
145.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion grabs Petra by the throat and drags him over towards the window. Standing full in the daylight, Astarion slowly pulls Petra closer and closer to the sunbeam.

6.speaker: Player
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion grabs Petra by the throat and drags him over towards the window. Standing full in the daylight, Astarion slowly pulls Petra closer and closer to the sunbeam.

15.speaker: Pale Petras
15.text: Isn't it obvious, sister? He wants to ascend with the rest of us.
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion grabs Petra by the throat and drags him over towards the window. Standing full in the daylight, Astarion slowly pulls Petra closer and closer to the sunbeam.

149.speaker: Pale Petras
149.text: He heard about the ritual and the power our master will grant us, so he came back with his tail between his legs, hoping all would be forgiven.
149.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion grabs Petra by the throat and drags him over towards the window. Standing full in the daylight, Astarion slowly pulls Petra closer and closer to the sunbeam.

128.speaker: Astarion
128.text: You always were an idiot, Petras.
128.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion grabs Petra by the throat and drags him over towards the window. Standing full in the daylight, Astarion slowly pulls Petra closer and closer to the sunbeam.

45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion grabs Petra by the throat and drags him over towards the window. Standing full in the daylight, Astarion slowly pulls Petra closer and closer to the sunbeam.

118.context: CinematicNodeContext: Petra's close enough to the sunlight that he's starting to smoke

85.speaker: Dalyria
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: Petra's close enough to the sunlight that he's starting to smoke

20.speaker: Astarion
20.text: Why does Cazador need me? What is he planning?
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Petra's close enough to the sunlight that he's starting to smoke

35.speaker: Pale Petras
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Petra is starting to burn in the light

54.speaker: Player
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion throws Petras away, releasing his grip on his throat. Petras and Dalyria revert to default positions in the dialog.

71.speaker: Astarion
71.text: You heard them. Tell me what I need to know. Now.
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion throws Petras away, releasing his grip on his throat. Petras and Dalyria revert to default positions in the dialog.

62.speaker: Dalyria
62.text: The master is preparing the Black Mass. Beneath his palace. There's a defiled chapel - it was hidden there the entire time. Hidden from us all.
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion throws Petras away, releasing his grip on his throat. Petras and Dalyria revert to default positions in the dialog.

73.speaker: Astarion
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion throws Petras away, releasing his grip on his throat. Petras and Dalyria revert to default positions in the dialog.

56.speaker: Dalyria
56.text: The Black Mass - it will be his triumph. He'll complete the ritual and emerge the Vampire Ascendant.
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion throws Petras away, releasing his grip on his throat. Petras and Dalyria revert to default positions in the dialog.

14.speaker: Dalyria
14.text: He'll walk in the sun, he'll be free of the hunger, he'll wield power no vampire has ever possessed.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion throws Petras away, releasing his grip on his throat. Petras and Dalyria revert to default positions in the dialog.

81.speaker: Dalyria
81.text: Best of all, we'll join him. His loyal servants - walking in the light as living vampires. We'll be free, brother.
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion throws Petras away, releasing his grip on his throat. Petras and Dalyria revert to default positions in the dialog.

90.speaker: Astarion
90.text: You can't believe that. You can't be that stupid.
90.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion throws Petras away, releasing his grip on his throat. Petras and Dalyria revert to default positions in the dialog.

110.speaker: Astarion
110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion throws Petras away, releasing his grip on his throat. Petras and Dalyria revert to default positions in the dialog.

102.speaker: Pale Petras
102.text: What the hells happened to you, Astarion? What are you?

126.speaker: Astarion
126.text: I'm more than what I was. And I'm not afraid of anything anymore.

101.speaker: Astarion
101.text: The sun can't harm me, Cazador can't compel me. I'm the only person who can stop him.

31.speaker: Astarion
31.text: Now go, before I change my mind about roasting you, brother.

86.speaker: Player
86.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion throws Petras away, releasing his grip on his throat. Petras and Dalyria revert to default positions in the dialog.

131.speaker: Astarion
131.text: Tell me what I need to know, or I swear you'll burn.

42.speaker: Player
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion throws Petras away, releasing his grip on his throat. Petras and Dalyria revert to default positions in the dialog.

37.speaker: Astarion
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion throws Petras away, releasing his grip on his throat. Petras and Dalyria revert to default positions in the dialog.

21.speaker: Astarion
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion throws Petras away, releasing his grip on his throat. Petras and Dalyria revert to default positions in the dialog.

82.text: You owe your wretched life to my friend. Now tell me what I need to know.
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion throws Petras away, releasing his grip on his throat. Petras and Dalyria revert to default positions in the dialog.

147.text: You owe your wretched life to my friend. Now tell me what I need to know.
147.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion throws Petras away, releasing his grip on his throat. Petras and Dalyria revert to default positions in the dialog.

17.speaker: Astarion
17.text: You owe your wretched life to my friend. Now tell me what I need to know.

23.speaker: Dalyria
23.text: The master is preparing the Black Mass. Beneath his palace. There's a defiled chapel - it was hidden there the entire time. Hidden from us all.

4.speaker: Dalyria
4.text: Do you really think you can stop him?

27.speaker: Astarion
27.text: I'm the only one who can.

55.speaker: Astarion
55.text: The sun can't harm me, Cazador can't compel me. I don't need to fear him anymore.

93.speaker: Dalyria
93.text: The Black Mass - it will be his triumph. He'll complete the ritual and emerge the Vampire Ascendant.

139.speaker: Dalyria
139.text: He'll walk in the sun, he'll be free of the hunger, he'll tap into power no vampire has ever dreamed of.

140.speaker: Dalyria
140.text: Best of all, we'll join him. His loyal servants - walking in the light as living vampires. We'll be free, brother.

115.speaker: Astarion
115.text: You can't believe that, Dal. When has Cazador ever shared power?

117.speaker: Dalyria
117.text: We deserve this, Astarion. Can't you see? We've given him everything - our blood and tears - and he's finally going to reward us.

3.speaker: Dalyria
3.text: And you will be with us when the time comes. It's fate, written in your very flesh.

132.text: Poor fools. They actually think Cazador will save them...
132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vampire spawns turn to mist and vanish from the scene

122.text: Poor fools. They actually think Cazador will save them...

108.speaker: Astarion
108.text: Poor fools. They actually think Cazador will save them...

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: You sound surprised - I am capable of doing the right thing from time to time.

119.speaker: Astarion
119.text: Yes. And they'll be trembling in fear when they tell him.

134.speaker: Astarion
134.text: They're no threat to us, and they have no choice but to do Cazador's bidding. I pity them.

57.speaker: Astarion
57.text: Worst of all, they don't know their fate's already set. They're doomed.

125.speaker: Astarion
125.text: The only question is whether their lives will be sacrificed to a monster like Cazador or serve a greater purpose.

12.speaker: Astarion
12.text: Seven sigils on seven spawn, and Cazador has the other six. We have to face him and take that power for ourselves.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: Those six spawn are your brothers and sisters. Are you ready to sacrifice them?

16.speaker: Astarion
16.text: Trust me, I'd rather slaughter someone else's family, but... if that's what it takes.

129.speaker: Astarion
129.text: And it's not like they're sweet innocents: they brought Cazador just as many victims as I did.

11.speaker: Astarion
11.text: You're not getting sentimental, are you? I thought you were with me on this.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Why not stay away? Cazador can't finish the ritual if he can't find you.

1.speaker: Astarion
1.text: And spend every day looking over my shoulder? Waiting for someone to grab me and drag me back to the shadows?

25.speaker: Astarion
25.text: No, I won't spend eternity as a fugitive. I need to end this.

151.speaker: Astarion
151.text: Besides, I'll need something to protect me from the sun if things don't work out with our parasite friends. This ritual could set me free.

53.speaker: Astarion
53.text: And you want what's best for me, surely?

143.speaker: Player
143.text: I just want you to be happy.

44.speaker: Astarion
44.text: Then you'll help me in this. Nothing would make me happier.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: We're a team. I've got your back.

121.speaker: Astarion
121.text: I knew I was right about you. You're a true friend.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: And what if we're walking into a trap?

24.speaker: Astarion
24.text: Then we'll deal with it! It can't be worse than everything else we've faced.

137.speaker: Astarion
137.text: And now that we know he's skulking beneath his palace, we can take the hunt to Cazador.

116.speaker: Astarion
116.text: Well figure it out. I need to know I can rely on you.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Can we go? We got what we need - the ritual's below the palace.

124.speaker: Astarion
124.text: All right, let's go. This place stinks of rat blood and despair.

120.speaker: Player
120.context: NodeContext: "Well yes, TECHNICALLY only I'll have all the power..."

30.speaker: Astarion
30.text: Well yes, technically only I will ascend and gain the ritual's power.
30.context: NodeContext: "Well yes, TECHNICALLY only I'll have all the power..."

74.speaker: Astarion
74.text: But we're a team. If I become all-powerful, then we become all-powerful.
74.context: NodeContext: emphasis on "I" and "we", as if explaining to a child

89.speaker: Astarion
89.text: We are a team, aren't we? You're still with me?

127.speaker: Player
127.text: Sometimes you scare me more than the elder brain does.

105.speaker: Astarion
105.text: But there's nothing to be afraid of - we're a team after all.

107.speaker: Astarion
107.text: I knew I could count on you. It's that killer instinct I love so much.

61.speaker: Astarion
61.text: I knew I could count on you. We share that killer instinct.

100.speaker: Astarion
100.text: And now we know that Cazador's skulking somewhere beneath the palace, it'll be infinitely easier to track him down.

123.speaker: Astarion
123.context: NodeContext: Contemplating just how good that would be

36.speaker: Astarion
36.text: Who wouldn't be interested? It's the ultimate freedom.

41.speaker: Astarion
41.text: Freedom from the hunger, freedom to live a real life in the sun - no tadpole required.

92.speaker: Astarion
92.text: And if I were to ascend instead of him: freedom from Cazador, once and for all.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Aren't you part of the sacrifice? Surely you'd be destroyed too?

63.speaker: Astarion
63.text: Perhaps, but it's a devils' deal. They always have some loophole or another.

136.speaker: Astarion
136.text: And just think - I could rid myself of the mind flayers' parasite without losing anything.

49.speaker: Astarion
49.text: In fact, I'd be more powerful than ever. More powerful than any vampire has ever been.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: I'm with you, no matter what.

39.speaker: Astarion
39.text: I am. More sure than I've ever been.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: If it was possible to take Cazador's place, you'd have to sacrifice the other spawn.

87.speaker: Astarion
87.text: It comes with a cost, yes. All great things do.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Is that possible? For you to take his place?

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: Well, it might be. And there's only one way to find out.

50.speaker: Astarion
50.text: It doesn't feel like a lie. It feels like exactly the kind of power Cazador would chase.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Don't get ahead of yourself - there's a lot we don't know.

99.speaker: Astarion
99.text: Perhaps, but if I don't confront him some day, I know I'll spend the rest of my life running from him.

9.speaker: Astarion
9.text: And if I can take this power from him, it would set me free. Truly free.

2.speaker: Astarion
2.text: I have to know. I have to face him.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: What of it? You can already walk in the sun.

40.speaker: Astarion
40.text: Yes, but only because of the parasite. This would be true freedom.

150.text: Don't tell me what to do!
150.context: CinematicNodeContext: turning to look at player over his shoulder while still holding Petra by the throat

133.speaker: Astarion
133.text: Don't tell me what to do!
133.context: CinematicNodeContext: turning to look at player over his shoulder while still holding Petra by the throat

60.speaker: Pale Petras
60.text: You never liked following orders, brother. That's why you won't ascend with the rest of us.

26.speaker: Astarion
26.text: Where is he hiding? TELL ME.
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Petra's close enough to the sunlight that he's starting to smoke
